important.para: OpenAM ${serverDocTargetVersion} is a maintenance release that resolves a number of issues, including security issues in OpenAM. It is strongly recommended that you update to this release to make your deployment more secure, and to take advantage of important functional fixes. ForgeRock customers can contact support for help and further information.

itemizedlist.para: Before you install OpenAM or update your existing OpenAM installation, read these release notes. Then update or install OpenAM.

listitem.para: If you have already installed OpenAM, see To Update OpenAM From 11.0.

Do not perform an upgrade by deploying the new version and then importing an existing configuration by running the ssoadm import-svc-config command. Importing an outdated configuration can result in a corrupted installation.
If you are installing OpenAM for the first time, see To Install OpenAM.

section.title: Product Enhancements
section.para: In addition to fixes, this release includes the following limited product enhancements:

listitem.para: Add option to enable debug logging of decrypted SAML assertions. OpenAM now provides a debug logging option to decrypt SAML assertions when OpenAM runs as a service provider and assertion encryption is enabled (OPENAM-1631).
DAS Supports goto URL Validation. DAS now validates goto and gotoOnFail URLs (OPENAM-1773).

The list of valid goto/gotoOnFail resources has moved to the newly created "Validation Service" under the openam-auth-valid-goto-resources property. New installations should use the new setting; for existing deployments, the upgrade wizard ensures the migration of the existing configuration.
Authentication Context extensibility support. OpenAM supports the extensibility of authentication context classes as described in the SAMLv2 specification. (OPENAM-2238).
Password Reset Token Validation REST API. OpenAM now allows for the verification of password reset tokens through the REST API. For more information, see (OPENAM-3748).
Default Timelimit using Netscape SDK is Configurable. The default timelimit for LDAP operations performed using the Netscape SDK is now configurable (OPENAM-5311).
